summary:
Dr. Postema is a certified cardiologist-electrophysiologist at the Heart Center @Amsterdam University Medical Centers, The Netherlands. He received both his propaedeutic and medical degree cum laude at the Free University in Amsterdam and his philosopher’s degree cum laude at the University of Amsterdam. During training he performed research at the Department of Cardiology and the Rayne Institute at Guy’s, King’s and St Thomas’ School of Medicine, King’s College London, UK.

Dr. Postema is involved in the three academic pillars: patient care, medical education and research.

His patient care particularly encompasses patients with arrhythmia, pacemakers or implantable defibrillators. This involves both atrial and ventricular ablation procedures and implantations of pacemakers, defibrillators and cardiac resynchronization therapy. He is also strongly involved in cardiogenetics and in innovative treatment modalities for recurrent ventricular arrhythmia, e.g. cardiac radioablation. He is certified by the Dutch Cardiac Society (NVVC) and European Society of Cardiology (ESC) as a cardiologist and by the European Heart Rhythm Association (EHRA) as an electrophysiology specialist (ECES) and cardiac device specialist (ECDS).

His medical education involves teaching cardiology, particularly electrocardiography and electrophysiology, to medical doctors, nurses, students, allied professionals, patients and their relatives, locally and internationally. The latter is exemplified by his involvement in the non-profit CardioNetworks Foundation devoted to improving free access to medical knowledge throughout the world. He also is the founder and director of BrugadaDrugs.org devoted to provide free worldwide access to knowledge on drug use in Brugada syndrome for medical professionals, patients and their relatives.

His pre-clinical and clinical research is based on two intertwined topics, 1) the diagnosis, pathophysiological mechanisms, and treatment of malignant cardiac arrhythmias both in inheritable and acquired cardiac disease, and 2) electrocardiography in inheritable and acquired cardiac disease and on the population level with special focus on age, sex and ethnicity. Both these subjects are investigated within strong international collaborations.

Amongst others, is Dr. Postema a member of the Scientific Advisory Group on Cardiovascular Issues of the European Medicines Agency (EMA), member of the European Reference Network for low prevalence complex diseases of the heart (ERN Guard-Heart) and editorial board member of multiple international cardiology journals.

projects.title: StereoTactic Arrhythmia Radiotherapy in the Netherlands (STARNL)
projects.description: First trial on cardiac radiotherapy for recurrent ventricular tachycardia in the Netherlands.

Member of the Editorial Board of Heart Rhythm

profile_positions.description: The Cardionetworks Foundation is a non-profit organization. The goal and aim of the Foundation are to improve medical knowledge, especially in the field of cardiology, and to provide access to this knowledge by facilitating publications in digital or other form, amongst other means by building and maintaining websites
profile_positions.title: Secretary

profile_positions.description:
Director of www.BrugadaDrugs.org, a website concerning the safe use of drugs in Brugada syndrome (an inheritable arrhythmia syndrome associated with sudden cardiac death)

Chair of the BrugadaDrugs.org Advisory Board. The advisory board provides consultation and aids in making decisions regarding our drug lists. This includes decisions regarding placing new drugs on our lists, as well as removing or changing the status of drugs.
profile_positions.title: Director
